result.execSummary:
The defendant Samaria L Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 2 days Jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samaria L Bell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: scanned and destroyed

Defendant Samaria L Bell in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend to a non criminal DC for count #4.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Court finds the defendant guilty of the amended Count #4.  Count #3 is dismissed and read in.  
Court orders the following:  Count #4
Forfeiture:  $295.00 to be paid within 90 days.  Failure to pay will result in 2 day jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Samaria L Bell in court with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samaria L Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin for Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins in court.   Defendant Samaria L Bell did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Perkins has not heard from her client.  Court revokes/forfeits bail.  Court issues a capias, cashbail in the amount of $400.00.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
